paper_abstract: This note gives a numerical investigation for the popular high resolution conservative schemes when applied to inviscid, compressible, perfect gas flows with an initial high density ratio as well as a high pressure ratio. The results show that they work very inefficiently and may give inaccurate numerical results even over a very fine mesh when applied to such a problem. Numerical tests show that increasing the order of accuracy of the numerical schemes does not help much in improving the numerical results. How to cure this difficulty is still open. (c) 2006 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Note on the conservative schemes for the Euler equations
